**[English]()**

 • [한국어](/wiki/Copper/ko "Copper/ko")

**Copper** is a [material](/wiki/Material "Material") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Origin](#Origin)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 GruntHack](#GruntHack)
  - [5.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.3 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [5.4 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [5.5 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [6 References](#References)

## Description

Copper material consists of a family of similarly-colored, copper-alloyed metals which are susceptible to [corrosion](/wiki/Corrosion "Corrosion") but not [rust](/wiki/Rust "Rust"). All forms of copper can be eaten by [metallivores](/wiki/Metallivore "Metallivore"). In-game, copper items are referred to as "copper", "**bronze**", or "**brass**".

The following items are made of copper:

- [Bronze plate mail](/wiki/Bronze_plate_mail "Bronze plate mail")
- Both types of [lamp](/wiki/Lamp "Lamp")
- [Brass lantern](/wiki/Brass_lantern "Brass lantern")
- [Bugles](/wiki/Bugle "Bugle")
- [Bells](/wiki/Bell "Bell")
- [Rings](/wiki/Ring "Ring") with the [randomized appearance](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") of "bronze", "brass" or "copper"
- [Wands](/wiki/Wand "Wand") with the randomized appearance of "brass" or "copper"

[Polypiling](/wiki/Polypiling "Polypiling") enough copper objects may create either a [stone golem](/wiki/Stone_golem "Stone golem") or a [clay golem](/wiki/Clay_golem "Clay golem").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Strategy

Depending on which rings they represent, copper rings may be worth [eating](/wiki/Eating_jewelry "Eating jewelry") for their intrinsics.

## History

Copper items were introduced in [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0") with the inclusion of copper and brass as randomized appearances for wands and rings.

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

Copper is a chemical element with the symbol *Cu* (from Latin: *cuprum*) and atomic number 29. It is a soft, malleable, and ductile metal with very high thermal and electrical conductivity. Copper is used as a building material and a component of various metal alloys, and copper compounds are used as bacteriostatic agents (which stop bacteria from reproducing), fungicides and wood preservatives.

Copper is one of the few metals that can occur in nature in a directly usable metallic form, which led to very early human use dating back as far as around 8000 BC. In the Roman era, copper was mined principally on Cyprus, from which the material's name is derived (from Latin *aes cyprium*, "metal of Cyprus", later corrupted to *cuprum*).

Copper was the first metal to be smelted from sulfide ores, cast into a shape in a mold, and the first to be purposely alloyed with another metal. Bronze usually refers to copper-tin alloys, but can refer to any alloy of copper such as aluminium bronze, while brass is an alloy of copper and zinc. Copper used in buildings, usually for roofing, oxidizes to form a green patina of compounds called verdigris. Copper is sometimes used in decorative art, both in its elemental metal form and in compounds as pigments.

## Variants

Variants often add other items made of copper, and the [object materials](/wiki/Object_materials "Object materials") system used in many variants incorporates copper as a potential material for metallic objects.

### GruntHack

In [GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack"), copper is a slightly heavier material than iron, and objects made from copper are priced roughly the same; copper armor is slightly weaker than iron armor of the same type, providing 1 less point of [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") (minimum 0).

[Iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron") and [wooden](/wiki/Wood "Wood") objects have a small chance of being made of copper, and [elven armor](/wiki/Elven_armor "Elven armor") and weapons are commonly made of copper.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), the following items are made of copper:

- [khopesh](/index.php?title=Khopesh\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Khopesh (page does not exist)")
- [archaic helm](/index.php?title=Archaic_helm\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Archaic helm (page does not exist)")
- [archaic plate mail](/index.php?title=Archaic_plate_mail\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Archaic plate mail (page does not exist)")
- [roundshield](/wiki/Roundshield "Roundshield")
- [archaic gauntlets](/index.php?title=Archaic_gauntlets\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Archaic gauntlets (page does not exist)")
- [archaic boots](/index.php?title=Archaic_boots\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Archaic boots (page does not exist)")

The [Cuprilach Rilmani](/wiki/Cuprilach_Rilmani "Cuprilach Rilmani") are [monsters](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that have an affinity to copper and bronze.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), copper weapons deal bonus damage to [fungi](/wiki/Fungi "Fungi") and monsters with [disease](/wiki/Disease "Disease") or [decay](/wiki/Decay "Decay") attacks. Copper armor provides 1 less AC than its iron counterparts, but can sometimes prevent you from catching [sickness](/wiki/Sickness "Sickness") with a 1⁄5 chance; this chance stacks with each piece of copper armor worn.

All elven weapons, including [Sting](/wiki/Sting "Sting") and [Orcrist](/wiki/Orcrist "Orcrist"), have a base material of copper, and players elves in roles that normally start with iron items will have them replaced with the copper equivalent.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") and [SpliceHack-Rewrite](/wiki/SpliceHack-Rewrite "SpliceHack-Rewrite"), copper weapons also deal bonus damage to fungi and monsters with disease or sickness attacks. As in other variants, copper armor provides 1 less AC than its iron counterparts.

Standard iron and wooden objects have a small chance of being made of copper. 'Shiny' and 'resonant' items (e.g. [shield of reflection](/wiki/Shield_of_reflection "Shield of reflection"), [resonant shield](/wiki/Resonant_shield "Resonant shield"), [bugle](/wiki/Bugle "Bugle"), etc.) have a significantly higher chance; [elven helms](/wiki/Elven_helm "Elven helm"), [horns](/wiki/Horn "Horn") and [firearms](/wiki/Firearms "Firearms") also have better chances to be made of copper.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), copper armor provides 1 less AC than its iron counterparts. [Secespita](/wiki/Secespita "Secespita") is an [artifact weapon](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife") made of copper.

Standard iron and wooden objects have a small chance of being made of copper, while dwarven and orcish items cannot be made of copper. Elven items are more likely to be made of copper compared to other items.
